item.title: Laurie add a quote by Antonin Artaud
item.description: "Without sarcasm I sink into chaos." -- Antonin Artaud

item.title: Laurie add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Life is too short to read a bad book." -- James Joyce

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Libraries really are wonderful. They're better than bookshops, even. I mean bookshops make a profit on selling you books, but libraries just sit there lending you books quietly out of the goodness of their hearts." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "There's a sunrise and a sunset every single day, and they're absolutely free. Don't miss so many of them." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Bibliotropic," Hugh said. "Like sunflowers are heliotropic, they naturally turn towards the sun. We naturally turn towards the bookshop." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Interlibrary loans are a wonder of the world and a glory of civilization." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "There are some awful things in the world, it's true, but there are also some great books." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "It's amazing how large the things are that it's possible to overlook." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Reading is awesome and flexible and fits around chores and earning money and building the future and whatever else I’m doing that day. My attitude towards reading is entirely Epicurean—reading is pleasure and I pursue it purely because I like it." -- Jo Walton
